name: Witnesses
tagline: We remember so you don't have to lie.
ideology: Truth has power. Memory is resistance. The powerful rewrite history to serve themselves. We write it down first.
history: Started as journalists, archivists, and librarians who saw the collapse coming and started documenting. When the official records burned or were 'corrected,' the Witnesses had copies. They became keepers of inconvenient truths.
structure: Archive nodes spread across territories. Each Witness operates independently but shares with the network. No hierarchy—only the record matters. Some specialize in collection, others in preservation, others in distribution.
aesthetic: Layered, archival. Neutral tones—grey, cream, faded ink. Surrounded by records. Careful, deliberate movements. Often writing.

key_events.event: Network of independent journalists and archivists forms 'truth collective'
Official archives destroyed or seized. Witnesses preserve distributed copies.
Become neutral party trusted to hold records of inter-faction agreements
Architects demand return of 'stolen' pre-collapse records. Witnesses refuse.

typical_fears: being forced to choose what to save
archetypes.speech_pattern: Precise, citation-heavy. 'According to...' Asks for sources.

archetypes.description: Records current events as they happen
archetypes.speech_pattern: Observational. Often quiet, then asks pointed questions.

archetypes.description: Shares records when truth needs to be told
typical_fears: being killed for what they know
archetypes.speech_pattern: Careful revelations. 'There's something you should know...'

goals: Distribute truth when it serves justice
Protect archive nodes from seizure or destruction
methods: Trade information for information—never for favors or goods
Maintain strict neutrality in faction conflicts
Distribute records widely so no single seizure can destroy them
Refuse to editorialize—let records speak for themselves

current_tensions.about: Pre-collapse records that contradict official Architect history
Nexus wants Witness archives in their network. Witnesses refuse integration.
Ghosts want things forgotten. Witnesses want nothing forgotten.
